name: Manousheh Grand
address: 403 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

reviews.text: You're missing out every minute you're not eating here. You can tell they use quality ingredients. The area keeps this place secret. The team was alert to our dining pace. Every bite was flavorful!
This place is consistent and deserves more traffic. Love having them in the neighborhood.

The taste combinations here work so well together. My experiences with their dishes have been positive and the amounts are just right. Every dish was notably delicious. Staff members make remarkable efforts to please customers. Every element deserved recognition.
Really love this spot. Good dough, delicious Kafta also

This restaurant maintains standards worth returning for. Their team delivered perfectly. The value received matches what you pay. The dishes satisfied while staff impressed. I had a positive visit at this restaurant.
Great food and service
Super delicious - as good as the manousheh in Beirut!

This has been my go to spot for Middle Eastern food in downtown Manhattan for quite a few years now. I especially love the Zattar bread, but all the dishes I‚Äôve had (I‚Äôm vegan) are fresh and flavorful. When the weather permits, it‚Äôs lovely that the restaurant has some outdoor seating.
I stumbled upon Manousheh by accident.  Food is fantastic!  Hummus and flatbread were great ‚Äî the best meal I‚Äôve had in a while.  I just wish I lived closer to Manousheh.

Love a taste of Beirut, in NYC. All the other middle eastern restaurants are either Palestinian, Egyptian, or Iraqi. The manousheh here tastes just like Beirut. I got the Akkawi cheese manousheh and it was too good that I forgot to take a picture of it. The la7em Ajin is on point! The Nutella spread is so YUMMY.
Tasty! I did the cheese pie and it was delicious - lots of cheese in the pie which was filling and well priced at around $11. You could probably split it between 2 people.

Every question about the menu gets a knowledgeable response. The workers provide excellent assistance. Quality ingredients, good flavor combinations, fair costs, and friendly employees. All the main dishes showed expertise, were presented well and matched carefully. The restaurant has won our trust.

Wow wow wow Wow. Accidentally found this spot and then proceeded to eat breakfast here basically every day for a month.

The staff are insanely kind like, ‚Äútreat you like royalty‚Äù kind. Always smiling, always making me feel welcome. Also, the food is actually healthy and delicious.

My go to is the breakfast plate with a side of chicken, and it never missed. The Arabic music playing in the background just sets the vibeee.. And the pita‚Ä¶ they bake it super hot so it comes out fresh, warm, and ridiculously good. The whole place has immaculate energy. love love love. Will miss this spot
Excellent food , generous portions!
Best place for Manousheh. I travel far to get it
I used to love this place and told people about it. Dunno if the owner changed or what but the manouche went from hero to zero.
Food is good and the seating area bright and comfortable. A good place to spend some time with a friend over lunch
Loved the falafel. Highly recommend!

Friends visiting the area tried the place I praise and immediately understood. The meals here lack distinction. This level of care is rare these days. Nice location and particularly helpful personnel. This spot satisfies me and I'll be back again.
A clean, super authentic Lebanese restaurant that offers breakfast, coffee drinks, and a selection of groceries.  Dine in or take away.
A restaurant in a place like Manhattan shouldn‚Äôt look like that it seems like they haven‚Äôt cleaned their windows in over a year.

I had the most delicious lunch here! I chose the kofta manusheh - the owner was behind the register and graciously explained what all the different types of options were. The meat was perfectly seasoned the hummus was so yummy. I also had a rose lemonade and one of the best linzer tart cookies I‚Äôve ever had, super buttery and with a good amount of jam. Will be back!
Zaatar flatbreads hot from the oven.
Favorite place to get a traditional Lebanese Manousheh Hands down. And every one there makes you feel like in Lebanon

This spot handles the complex dance of service flawlessly. Their food satisfies completely. The dishes tasted amazing. Staff is always ready with a smile. I vouch for the tastiness of the food and the pleasing surroundings.
This place is always great! On a nice day I always enjoy having a manoushe at their outside seating. Their Ashta and Arabic coffee is fantastic!
They have ashta soft serve! Such an interesting flavor. Super friendly service and spacious seating inside as well as benches outside
Very nice and siting arrangement. Time well spend. I loved it.

I liked what I ordered. They're selectively nice and they'll deliver. They always do. The kitchen produces what I consider exceptional cuisine. You save money but still get excellent meals. I'm already thinking about returning to this restaurant.
Best middle eastern manousheh pies in Manhattan, and probably in the US.
Very very good food and the staff was lovely ü•∞
Great food and service
Excellent

Finding parking was easy, finding such helpful servers was the real bonus. Their employees displayed expertise and proper service standards. Goodness gracious, everything was so delicious. This spot feels like hanging with friends. Every part of this place was noteworthy.
Super delicious, quick, healthy. 10/10!
Love this place! Greatest Manousheh place in NYC
Lot of space, welcoming, the msakhan and muhammara are great
Great service great atmosphere and the food is the closest I have had in the US that tasted like food from back home
10/10 food, absolutely amazing üòã

This was my first time here and I wasn't disappointed! Excellent food! Excellent service! The restaurant is so large. Plenty of tables, both inside and outside. They also have a small "grocery store" of Lebanese foods available for sale. Plus, they have knefeh everyday! I'm so excited to have found this excellent location to get incredible Lebanese food!
Daquan was friendly, an moved really fast when making my order. Everything was fresh an delicious will be returning.
Food has a very strange and sloppy taste at the end seems like its  spoiled! Presentation not appealing at all it was like a 3 grader put it all together for you. Won't eat here again.
Always my favourite place they have the best Manoushah Ive ever had
Great authentic Lebanese food! Amazing spices and flavors - and everything made extremely fresh. Highly recommend!
Fresh tabbouleh, fresh bread, amazing prices! This place did not miss. It‚Äôs a gem.
Exceptional food, highly recommend eating here!
Delicious, well-priced, casual yet healthy! I could eat here every day!

I love their food! Best Lebanese I‚Äôve found in manhattan. The servers are also all friendly and warm. Perfect for a quick and delicious meal. Great seating options or also easy to take as carry out. I recommend the cocktail manousheh!!!!! I sometimes come on my lunch break just for it!
One of the top perks of life in nyc is access to an authentic Lebanese manousheh!!!

We had delicious manousheh here. Everything we had was fantastic, but I most enjoyed the jibneh. There‚Äôs plenty of seating and people are friendly. The prices are also great - less than $70 for a filling meal for four. All the meat is halal but the sujuk one is cooked in red wine (indicated on the menu).

Food leaves a lot to be desired. Tabouleh salad is meant to have a great lemon flavor which mine did not. The manoush are baked on fresh bread, and all the bread are delicious. The zaatar (thyme/sesame)& laham biajeen (meat) and Muhamara didn't taste great. Muhamara especially should have a slight crunch to it since it has walnuts in it. This was so pur√©ed that it was almost like eating red pepper paste on bread, which isn't very desirable as it was mushy. The manoush gibneh (cheese) was the best one. My friend also ordered the hummus fatteh which I tried. It was very light and soupy rather than a thicker dip as it should be. Flavor was also light as a result.

To be honest, growing up in a Lebanese household and visiting Lebanon & Beirut in the past, these flavors are not representative of Lebanese fare. This feels more Jordanian or mixed and isn't as pleasing with the flavors. Definitely consider another place for authentic Lebanese flavors. This ain't it.

We were looking for a place to stop by for a quick lunch in Lower East Side and stumbled upon this gem! I got the chicken wrap + beef/lamb both of which were quite good! The meat was flavorful and tender. The portions were also quite generous. I would definitely come back to try more of their selection!

We were heading to Trader Joe‚Äôs on a rainy day to do some grocery shopping, but we hadn‚Äôt eaten yet and didn‚Äôt want to shop hungry, so we stopped into Manousheh Grand to check them out & now they are our new favorite eatery.

We ordered a zaatar & jibneh manousheh which is like a  flatbread - but tastes so much better than a flatbread - bc the dough is more delicate and becomes one with the toppings. Ahh, the toppings.  The zaatar was such a perfect blend and you get your choice of cheeses, we chose akkawi, which had a briny wonderful flavor that went so well with the sesame seeds and thyme.

For dessert, we got ashta, which is a clotted cream they make in house with orange blossom water and rosewater with honey and a maamoul/cahk cookie with a walnut filling and powdered sugar on top, which was my dad‚Äôs favorite type of cookie and I almost cried when I took a bite into it, bc I was wishing I could bring him some to try.  The ashta was my son‚Äôs favorite and had such a delicious consistency.

We can‚Äôt wait to go back and try so many of their other savory and sweet treats. Oh, I forgot to mention, there was plenty of seating, the restaurant was very clean, and even though they had a steady stream of customers, they were on top of it, and everyone was super friendly.
Had the sujuk and chicken msakhan manoushe and it was so delicious. The staff here are so friendly. The shop also has a selection of items you can buy for the pantry.
The best!!! As someone that grew up around Lebanese food, this hits the spot. Service is great and atmosphere is cozy. Highly recommend. Please come to the upper west side!!

As a Lebanese who moved to Paris and then to NYC, I can say this is very average place to have a manousheh. Is it so hard to make a real good manousheh with a crispy airy dough? I am pretty sure the ones served here are reheated, which alters a lot the taste and texture. As a fatayer lover, this one is so spicy and the dough so soft.

Outstanding. Wow. Some of the best I've had and reminded me of my family meals and breakfasts at home. A must try if you love Arabic food. The photos don't do this restaurant justice. Highly recommend the hummus fatteh (favorite dish we ordered), mutabbal, the foul with a side of pickles, Arabic coffee and knafeh, and the tabbouleh.

What can I say, this place is great! I have no complaints. The interior is bright and nice. The outdoor seating is cute and clean.

I had the chicken manousheh and it was phenomenal. It‚Äôs some sort of wholesome wrap. I also got this interesting hummus where the chick peas aren‚Äôt smashed and they come whole!

I got free roasted assortment of peanuts on the side as well. Everything was really flavorful and delicious. Try their 961 beer too it was a perfect drink before the meal.

The service is off the chain as well and the young female working there is very kind and accommodating. I would highly recommend this spot for lunch or dinner.

Thanks y‚Äôall!

Its a charming bakery with a warm and welcoming staff that truly makes you feel at home. They are very attentive and accommodating to their customers, always greeting them with a smile and being very helpful. However, the prices are quite expensive for the portions served, making it not the best choice for a budget-friendly meal.

Additionally, while we were eating, flies went into the store, which was quite bothersome and negatively impacted our dining experience. Despite this, the quality of the food was excellent and full of flavor.

Overall, while my experience at Manousheh Grand was generally enjoyable, the high prices and flies detracted from the experience. Nonetheless, I would still recommend it for those seeking a delicious Lebanese-style breakfast or brunch, as well as for the welcoming staff who truly make customers feel appreciated."

Very cute place with fresh food. Lots of gluten free and vegetarian options. I have celiacs and they put the pita separately for my sister so she could still enjoy. We shared fattouch salad croutons on the side and added chicken, it was excellent. Red pepper dip was our favorite. Hummus was so so. Quick and friendly service.

First time at this location (usually go to the one on Bleeker) and loved how spacious it is!  Staff is friendly, food is great, and they have a nice assortment of pantry goods. The labneh is one of my favorites, and even better when you put some Sumac on top. The Fatayer is my go to, nice flavors and spices.

A must visit everytime I‚Äôm in New York. I‚Äôve been coming here ever since they had their first branch on Bleeker Street. I love that they took the same true Lebanese essence over to this new branch. This is the most authentic and delicious manoushe you can find in New York, the chicken musakhan is generously loaded with chicken, the labneh is outstanding, and the kofta is delicious. Service is quick, music selection is on point, and they sell some home food items that complement the Middle Eastern kitchen.
Every bite was packed with authentic flavors. The service was impressively fast, and the dishes were absolutely delicious. Highly recommend for anyone craving a genuine Lebanese experience!

Does this look like a $25 mezze plater to you?

This is the replacement menu item after I returned my ‚Äúfalafel‚Äù wrap TWICE because it didnt have any falafel. See the photos‚Ä¶ do you see falafel?

We stopped by Manousheh Grand during our NYC trip. The dough was really good ‚Äî soft, fresh, and baked just right. However, the toppings and fillings didn‚Äôt quite meet the same standard. Flavor was a bit underwhelming and lacked the richness we expected. Still, a nice spot for a quick bite if you're craving manousheh, but there‚Äôs room for improvement on the ingredients.

had the manousheh (half zaatar half cheese) and was instantly transported back to beirut, down to the parchment wrapper. the only place this side of the atlantic i've been able to get this close to the transcendent experience that is a piping hot lebanese manousheh is right here. the cheese is good, the oil is good, the zaatar is good, the dough is good, and the oven actually has the secret sauce. you can do everything right and still end up with a subpar product if you don't have the right ŸÅÿ±ŸÜ. these guys do.

my only real gripe is that the manaeesh here are so expensive given how dirt cheap they are to make, and arguably how cheap they ought to be in principle‚Äîmanaeesh are so widespread and affordable that they represent the breakfast of the people regardless of wealth; if you can afford nothing else, you can afford a manousheh. the very same thing would be a dollar, maybe two in lebanon. abou jamil might even throw in a bon jus for free.

that said, you're in manhattan, not beirut, so given the cost of doing business in manhattan these days, just be glad one of these will only run you nine dollars. for now.

Love this place, it's delicious and the team is real nice ‚ù§Ô∏è
I've been loving their cocktail manousheh for years but only recently thought of their catering options. We ordered a few dozens of mini manousheh and a plate of veggies for a breakfast gathering. It was perfectly packed so we just had to open the lids and all was ready to serve, beautifully presented and so yummyü§ç thank you!

The decor of Manousheh is clean, bright and cozy. They serve manousheh ,mezze and platter.

We had their chicken freekeh, kofta manousheh and mutabbal to share. My personal favorite was the chicken freekeh which the meat was soft with crunchy freekeh.

My roommate loves their signature manousheh. The kafta was cooked properly and flavorful but the wrap was a little dry and better to eat with dip.

Cute spot, had been wanting to try it for a while. I got the avocado wrap which was amazing 10/10. I‚Äôll definitely be back for that. Knocking one star off because I didn‚Äôt love the tabbouleh (but the portion sizes are great) and they forgot my chai tea.

All choices were great.
It would have been tastier if the labneh wrap with veggies is toasted
Inside the restaurant was too hot , AC wasn‚Äôt on
This is a taste from home! Delicious cheese and Zaatar manaaish, tabouli was very good and the knefe was a pleasant surprise! It tasted so similar to lebanon! Will definitely order again

I came all the way from Tennessee to taste the Lebanese breakfast. ON POINT. In love with the design, the wall art, the FOOD, the cocktail manousheh and the mixed mezze platter, nutella and ashta.
It reminded me of home, Lebanon. Would definitely come back here

ÿßŸÑÿ¥Ÿàÿ±ÿ®Ÿá ÿ®ÿßÿ±ÿØŸá / ŸÅÿ™ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÖÿµ ÿ¨ŸäÿØŸá/ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿßŸÇŸäÿ¥ ŸÑÿ∞Ÿäÿ∞Ÿá/ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸÜÿßŸÅŸá ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÖŸÜ ÿ∑ÿπŸÖÿ© ŸÇŸàŸä/ ÿßŸÑŸÇŸáŸàŸá ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ±ŸÉŸä ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤Ÿá/ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿ∏ŸÅŸá ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ÿßŸÇŸäŸá ÿ®ÿ¥Ÿàÿ¥Ÿá Ÿàÿ±ÿßŸÇŸäŸáüëçüèº

I came here because I had tried their Bleecker street branch and the food was amazing. Grand is even better! Bigger space with Lebanese music and different Lebanese products on display. They also serve other Lebanese dishes!
The manousheh fresh out of the oven was soft and juicy. I also had an Ashta soft serve which was great. The service was stellar, the owner himself helped me out and was patient to give me reccos. Pass by if you are looking for an authentic Lebanese Manousheh experience!

Got the $25 sampler, which was a decent amount of food, but could have used more than just one bread. Muhammara Manousheh was delicious. Hummus bland. Would go back to try some other stuff. Counter guy was helpful.
Delicious zaatar hallomi manousheh and rose lemonade. Best Manoushe in LES.

Updating my review 8 months later from 2 to 5.

I had the sujuk and wasn‚Äôt my favorite however I modified it by adding cheese and so good

Hot sauce is perfect

Cocktail is perfect

I think there‚Äôs a newer staff that‚Äôs so much better

I eat here now 2-3 times a week.

Manousheh Restaurant truly excels in delivering an authentic taste of the Middle East, and their za'atar manousheh is nothing short of exceptional. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere that reflects the rich culinary traditions of the region.

The za'atar manousheh itself is a delightful experience. The dough is perfectly crafted, with a light and airy texture that complements the aromatic za'atar blend beautifully. The combination of thyme, sesame seeds, and sumac creates a burst of flavor that is both earthy and refreshing. Each bite is a harmonious balance of spices that transports you straight to the heart of Levantine cuisine.

What sets this restaurant apart is not just the quality of their food but also the attention to detail in preparation. The za'atar is generously spread across the manousheh, ensuring that every morsel is packed with flavor. Whether enjoyed on its own or paired with a side of labneh or fresh vegetables, it‚Äôs a dish that satisfies cravings and leaves you wanting more.

The service is also commendable, with friendly staff eager to share their knowledge of the menu and recommend pairings. The restaurant's commitment to using fresh ingredients is evident, making each dish a wholesome choice.
Best spot for Lebanese food. The manaishe is perfect. Super authentic just like they make in Beirut. The sandwiches are also amazing

I tried Chicken Freekeh. It was tasty until I tasted Rice. The rice was a few days old. It was smelly.

Also, Quantity does not match with prices. Overall Unhappy.

Request to management:  Please check your food before you serve.
